Row.Text: Bactrian Empire
Bactrian Empire
Bactrian Empire
Bactrian Empire
Bactrian Empire
Bactrian Empire
Bactria
Bactrian

Hail mighty Demetrius, O invincible king of Bactria! The land you rule is an exotic one, a last bastion of Greek culture at the edge of the known world. Renowed for your military prowess, never once were you defeated in battle, and hailed as a second Alexander, you launched expeditions into well beyond the Indus river; there, a new Indo-Greek kingdom would be formed, combining Hellenistic culture and Buddhism.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]Great King! Untold glories unfold themselves as new exotic horizons open up on these new lands; will you once more take command of the Greeks, and the Bactrians, and Indians and whomever else dares be brave enough to follow you into battle? Will you build a civilization that will stand the test of time?
Bactria
History

The Greco-Bactrian Kingdom was the easternmost part of the Hellenistic world, covering Bactria and Sogdiana in Central Asia from 250 to 125 BC. It was centered around the north of present-day Afghanistan. The expansion of the Greco-Bactrians into present-day northern India and Pakistan from 180 BC established the Indo-Greek Kingdom, which was to last until around 10 AD.
Bactra
Demetrias
Euthydemia
Eucratideia
Marakanda
Oxus
Caucasus
Eschate
Arachosia
Indus
Patalene

Sagala

Sirkap
Takht-i Sangin
Drapsaka
Termez
Bamyan
Bucephala
Surkh Kotal
Dalverzin Tepe
Tillya Tepe
Bucephalus
Euthydemus
Eucratides
Greek-Buddha
Bactrian Bacteria
Agathokleia
Olympias
Pythodorida
Phila
Roxana
History

Demetrius I was a Greek king (reigned c. 200–180 BC) of Bactria. He was the son of Euthydemus and succeeded him around 200 BC, after which he conquered extensive areas in what now is now Afghanistan and Pakistan; thus creating an Indo-Greek Kingdom far from Hellenistic Greece. He was never defeated in battle and was posthumously qualified as the Invincible (Aniketos) on the pedigree coins of his successor Agathocles.
Unknown - 180 BC
Demetrius
Leader of Bactria
King
Demetrius
Beyond the Orient

Settling grants [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness for each city captured after your last one was founded, and removes all [ICON_RESISTANCE] Resistance. Units gain 15 XP if a leader you've conquered from had a variant of their type.
Elephantarch

Unique Swordsman replacement available only to Bactria. Each [ICON_MOVES] Movement Point that is spent before attacking increases [ICON_STRENGTH] Combat Strength by 10%. Starts with more XP by the amount of [ICON_FOOD] Food produced there.

A highly aggressive unit that is better used by "charging" at the enemy before striking, as each movement point spent by it increases 10% of its strength. The Elephantarch is best trained in the largest cities of your empire, as [ICON_FOOD] becomes experience for the unit.

The third major arm of the Greco-Bactrian army were the Indian war elephants, which are depicted in some coins with a tower (thorakion) or howdah housing men armed with bows and javelins. This force grew as the Greco-Bactrian kingdom expanded into India and was widely depicted in Greco-Bactrian coinage.
Mighty Charge!
Stomp! This unit deals +10% Damage
Stomp! Stomp! This unit deals +20% Damage
Stomp! Stomp! Stomp! This unit deals +30% Damage
Stomp! Stomp! Stomp! Stomp! This unit deals +40% Damage
MEGASTOMP! This unit deals +50% Damage
It will grant a [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen to the city that works it if the Phrourion has a garrison.
Construct a [LINK=IMPROVEMENT_TCM_PHROURIA]Phrourion[\LINK]
Cannot be built adjacent to another Phrourion. With a military unit garrisoned, it will grant an extra [ICON_CITIZEN] Citizen to the city working the plot.
Phrourion

Alexander and Seleucus I settled Greeks in Bactria, while preferring to keep their Macedonian settlers farther west. Greek garrisons in the satrapy of Bactria were housed in fortresses called phrouria and at major cities. Military colonists were settled in the countryside and were each given an allotment of land called a kleros. These colonists numbered in the tens of thousands, and were trained in the fashion of the Macedonian army.
Our people are now sculpting Buddha statues and naming every city the same. I worry the rest of the world will also succumb to the influence of your culture.
Agathokleia
Foreign Ambassor

An ambassor from exotic lands faraway has arrived in Bactria, inquiring about our state and economy. Supposedly, his lord wishes to set up a trade route with us; but he might just be a spy and the prelude to an invasion.[NEWLINE]
Welcome him with a lavish feast.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gains a Caravan and [INTERNATIONAL_TRADE] Trade Route slot[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]Loses {1_GOLD} [ICON_GOLD] Gold[ENDCOLOR]
A profitable Trade Route has been established with the Ambassor.
Turn him away.
[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Gains free Walls on every city[ENDCOLOR]
We have sent the spy away and doubled the defenses of our empire.
An Usurper!

A disgruntled Bactrian general dared to revolt against your rule in {1_CityName} and declared himself basileus. While of course a threat to your empire, defeating him would serve well to legitimize your rule even further.[NEWLINE]
Bring me his head!

[ICON_BULLET][COLOR_NEGATIVE_TEXT]A Barbarian Great General and his army rise up in {1_CityName}[ENDCOLOR][NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Defeating him begins a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age.[ENDCOLOR]
An usurper has claimed the throne of Bactria!!!
Send Dignitaries and Merchants to Faraway Lands

We are privileged by our location among the most important trade routes of the world and by having wealthy neighbours to trade with. We should dispatch our emissaries to discuss treaties of commerce and friendship, or simply to better learn the inner workings of their empires... [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Bactria [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per era [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Culture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrate [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Reveals the entire empire of players you currently have an Embassy with [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receives {2_Gold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Note: [ICON_GOLD] Gold bonus increase with the number of Embassies

We are privileged by our location among the most important trade routes of the world and by having wealthy neighbours to trade with. We should dispatch our emissaries to discuss treaties of commerce and friendship, or simply to better learn the inner workings of their empires... [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Bactria [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]May only be enacted once per era [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Culture} [ICON_CULTURE] Culture [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [RESOURCE_JFD_DIGNITARIES] Dignitary [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Reveals the entire empire of players you currently have an Embassy with [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Receives {2_Gold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Note: [ICON_GOLD] Gold bonus increase with the number of Embassies

We are privileged by our location among the most important trade routes of the world and by having wealthy neighbours to trade with. We should dispatch our emissaries to discuss treaties of commerce and friendship, or simply to better learn the inner workings of their empires...
Hellenize the Local Customs

Our new subjects follow mysterious customs which are strange to us; we should teach them in our Greek ways instead, and encourage them to do so by adopting some of their customs as our own. [NEWLINE] [NEWLINE]Requirement/Restrictions: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Player must be Bactria [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must have captured at least 4 cities [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Must be in a [ICON_GOLDEN_AGE] Golden Age [NEWLINE]Costs: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]1 [ICON_MAGISTRATES] Magistrate [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{1_Gold} [ICON_GOLD] Gold [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]{2_Faith} [ICON_PEACE] Faith [NEWLINE]Rewards: [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Gain {3_Points} [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Artist Points on your [ICON_CAPITAL] Capital [NEWLINE][ICON_BULLET]Builds a [ICON_HAPPINESS_1] Happiness building on every city without one [NEWLINE][NEWLINE][COLOR_POSITIVE_TEXT]Note: Value of [ICON_GREAT_PEOPLE] Great Artist points increase with the number of followers of a foreign religion in your empire
Our new subjects follow mysterious customs which are strange to us; we should teach them in our Greek ways instead, and encourage them to do so by adopting some of their customs as our own.
Dispense presentations. You have reached Bactria; congratulations! What do you plan on doing next?
Yeah, yeah, I know you must be a very important king or ruler somewhere very far away from here but guess what? We're on Bactria now. Here I rule, while you are just another one on a list.
You are a though one, I'll give you that. Keep it up kid, you're going places.
Thank you kid. Your name shall forever immortalized on history, and whenever they remember of you, they'll remember of me too; the man who opposed you.
The heck is wrong with you? Stop that!
You gotta step up your game kid. This deal just ain't gonna cut.
C'mon kid, give me something!
I'm getting tired of this haggling.
Forgot something here, kid?
Hurry up with this.
What do you want, kid? I have enemies left and right here and don't want to have to babysit you too.
The heck are you still doing here kid? Get out of my kingdom.
Get lost.
Nice to see you here kid, but why have you come?
Salutations to you.
Hail.
What is it?
What do you want?
Start talking.
Spit it out, kid.
What are you doing here?
You come with a peace offer or are you here just to laugh at my face?
You have the upper hand now. I suggest you bring me the terms of surrender while you still can.
We should end this war already, kid.
Let's end this war now. I have bigger fish to fry.
Shall we end the war?
I'm not done with you yer, kiddo.
Can't take a punch, kid?
Lost the will to fight?
You are a liar and a thief. The heck are you doing here?
Good to see you around, kid.
It won't be long before we'll have dealt with {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey}. I can just feel it.
The downfall of {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} can't come any sooner.
Soon we'll have dealt with {1_ThirdPlayerName:textkey} once and for all.
Hah kid, what are you doing here? I've seen you fight in that war, and I have to say that you should be training instead.
Best of luck with your war. I can lend some advice, if you wish.
I see the army you bring with you. Is that supposed to scare me, kiddo?
I see you have quite the army around my borders. Better keep on marching to wherever you are going, kid.
Remember kid, you can have the land, but whomever has the army is the true master of it; and you have some catching up to do.
An empire to rival that of Alexander's, you have there! Let's see how long can we rule before bumping into eachother.
Remember kid, you can have that land you brought, but whomever has the army is the true master of it; and you have some catching up to do.
I suggest you spend that money to improve the military rather than on plots. Just a piece of advice.
Your military might rivals those of Alexander. Keep it up kid, for it is only through it that a man can rule men.
I've heard of the opulence of your empire. It almost matches mine, kid. That's impressive.
We Greeks rule empires now. Never thought I'd see another city-state again.
A ruler with no army is a ruler with no power; and a ruler with no power is no ruler at all. Better improve things over there before I decide to replace you.
I've heard of your warmongering. Every day I train harder to meet you on the battlefield; you shall be a worthy foe.
What is this sentimentalistic crap? We're not friends, kid.
Bactrian relations with {1_CivName} have broken down, will you support me in teaching them a lesson?
Then you're no better than them, kiddo.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
Then I have nothing more to do with you.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])

It was foolish of me to think we could be allies; here in Bactria we have no friends, and you just reminded me why.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
Nothing personal kid, but I can't be friends with those I intend to conquer.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
This one shows spirit! I am eager to face you on the battlefield once you are ready to take this to its next step.
Words can't hurt me, kid. If you really wanted to send a message, you'd be declaring war instead.
A friend of {1_CivName} could be an useful ally to Bactria. Let's see how this goes.
What, you're friends of {1_CivName}? Didn't know those losers had any at all.
I should remind you that {1_CivName} is my ally. If you push this issue further, remember that I'll be there to avenge him...
It's about time you realized {1_CivName} is up to no good.
If you can trust {1_CivName}, then so can I. Just don't let me down here, kid, I'm placing too much trust into you.
I agree that {1_CivName} must be stopped, and so I shall denounce him too. But we mustn't stop here; we should take the fight to those bastards.
An ally of {1_CivName} is no ally of mine.
Give {1_CivName} my regards, they'll make a fine ally against you.
I see your armies amassed near my empire. If you're tring to sneak up on me, you're doing a terrible job kid.
I see your armies near my borders. I suggest you keep on marching them elsewhere, kid.
You've broken your word to me, kiddo. Better watch your back now.
Your aggression against my ally, {@1_MinorCivName} does not go unnoticed. Stop this assault now or I'll have to step in.
Hah, I see you enjoy claiming every bit of land you can get your hands on. But do you happen to have an army to support this?
You're expanding into my lands now, kiddo. I suggest you back down from now onwards.
For your own sake, I do have to suggest that you stop claiming lands near me.
Your expansionism is admirable, but I suggest you do it elsewhere. These lands belong to Bactria.
You are a liar and a thief. These lands belong to me, and I'll not refrain myself from taking them back.
You waste too much gold on land and too little on your armies. I suggest you get your priorities straight before I forcefully correct them.
Kid, just stop. Gold can only give you land for so long before you piss off the wrong person.
So your word means nothing, huh kid? Let's see how much that beloved Gold of yours will help you once I get my revenge for this.
There are though battles ahead. I'd be honored to fight alongside you.
Will you walk with me as ally and friend?
There are though battles ahead. I'd be honored to fight alongside you.
Will you walk with me as ally and friend?
Take this as it is, kid. A prelude to war.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
Better start training your army, kid. I don't want to fight against a weakling.[NEWLINE][NEWLINE]([COLOR_WARNING_TEXT]They have publicly denounced us! NOTE: You are not at war.[ENDCOLOR])
There's no rest for those like us. Will you acompany me to arms against {1_PlayerName:textkey}, for conquest and glory?
It's time kiddo, today we march against {1_PlayerName:textkey}! Will you join me?
You've crossed a line, kid. Your actions are unforgivable.
It is clear to all that you are strong and mighty ruler. I can only hope to one day achieve such greatness.
Your highly aggressive behavior has not gone unnoticed. I'm eager to show my prowess against such foe as yourself.
Your warmongering is a popular topic these days. Better watch your back.
You're starting to attract quite a bit of attention. That's not a good thing.
Ah, how nice to see my favorite city-state again.
I'm really getting tired of seeing your face. I count the days till I finally get to bash it in.
Ah, it's just you kiddo. Sometimes I get you mixed up with the barbarians I have to swat from time to time.
A ruler with no army is a ruler with no power; and a ruler with no power is no ruler at all. Keep that in mind before I come to overthrow you.
You are unfit to serve as ruler of your people, for such a poor show of diplomatic skills you have displayed so far.
I've heard your people are quite unhappy with your rule. I'm sure they would be most grateful with a change of regimes...
I can't remember when was the last time I saw a city-state, but looking at your empire sufficed for me.
Travelers have told us that your empire's economy is in pretty sad shape. I wonder for how long you'll be able to support your empire before someone else takes it from you...
Hah, I almost mistook you for a barbarian. How can one be so uncivilized as yourself?
No chance kiddo.
I shall comply, for now.
Hah, who the hell do you think you are, kid?
That will work. Our alliance will be the envy of the world.
I'd be honored to fight alongside you.
Alright kid, I can help you out as an ally.
Definitely not.
Nah.
Not interested.
Gotta hand it to you kid, this is a great idea. Together, we will destroy this foe.
I'll have to prepare my army for such a confrontation. Give me 10 turns, and I'll come to you.
Let's hear it, kid.
What do you want?
This war has run its course, kid. What do you think of this peace offer?
The conflict is over. Let us return to peace.
We had our moments of glory, but now the time has come to make peace.
If you want to end the war tonight, we have to make a deal.
You have something I want. Give it to me or I'll take it by force.
I ask you of this on friendly terms. What do you think?
By opening our borders, there'll be one less point of contention between our two empires. Shall we do it?
My new target lies beyond your territory. Would you allow me to march my troops through it?
This deal strengthened our alliance years ago. Shall it be renewed?
The value of this deal has faded over the years. We need more from your side of the negotiation.
My people crave for a luxury of yours. Shall we make a deal?
I can't offer you enough to make this a fair trade.
Any deal I suggest would result in an unfair exchange for you.
The blood spilled today shall lay the foundations of my kingdom. And your rivers will run red with it.
Kid, if you believe that you are actually fit to rule your empire then now it is time to prove it.
You have betrayed your word. I'll go personally wipe that smile off your face, kiddo.
I clearly can make better use of those lands than you, kid. I suggest you hand em' over nice 'n easy.
You are but a petty ruler on my path to eternal glory. I'll show you what fighting against a TRUE king feels like.
Your empire is crumbling. Let a piece of it be of use to me, at least.
I clearly can make better use of those lands than you, kid. I suggest you hand em' over nice 'n easy.
Kid, if you believe that you are actually fit to rule your empire then now it is time to prove it.
It's the nature of the weak to serve the strong. I'm coming for your crown, kiddo.
At last! A worthy foe!
We've no friends here on Bactria, you should've learned that by now. It is kill or be killed, and I intend to remain alive and kicking.
We've no friends here on Bactria, you should've learned that by now. It is kill or be killed, and I intend to remain alive and kicking even against all odds.
I'll storm your cities until I get what I want.
Then war it is.
At last, we will face eachother. May the best general win
I'll make you understand why they call me invincible.
Do remember they call be invincible for a reason.
My men are eager to train with your army.
You send your armies to certain death. What a foolish ruler you are, kid.
Remember kid! No mercy.
I'll make you understand why they call me invincible.
You are done for, kid.
I'll certainly enjoy watching your spectacular fall here.
You are too reckless, kid. You have no idea what you just unleashed upon your people.
Let's take this into the field, kid. I'll make you regret the day you were born.
At last! Real battle!
I'm eager to face your armies on the battlefield!
Bring it on, kid.
Trying to prove yourself here, are you now kid? Do know that I will not hold back.
Maybe you can finally learn a thing or two about warfare from me now, kiddo.
Our paths didn't have to cross now, kiddo. But since they have...
You betrayed your word, kiddo. I'll go personally wipe that smile off your face.
What do you bring to placate me?
What would you suggest?
What is the price of peace?
My armies still seek glory on the battlefield.
I'll not be denied of this glory.
Are you that afraid?
Hah kid, you're such a jokester.
Excellent.
Thanks, kid
I am pleased to hear this.
That is good to hear.
Thanks, kiddo.
You are truly a great ally.
History will long remember these good deeds.
Disappointing.
Too bad.
This is disappointing.
So be it.
Then you will be responsible for the consequences.
You will regret this.
Thank you for freeing my people from those filthy barbarians.
Appreciate it, kid. I'll remember your good deeds.
Thanks, kid. May this be remembered as a historic event which brought our two great empires closer together.
How dare you? There will be consequences for this.
If you are trying to provoke a war, you're doing a fine job.
We'll see about that.
Yes, that's right.
Well, what are we waiting for then?
A likely story.
So be it kiddo, but you'll regret this.
Right.
I remain confident that my decision was the best for my people and my nation.
You truly cannot be reasoned with.
We should consider exchanging embassies, which would allow for more advanced diplomacy between our peoples.
We would like to set up an embassy in your capital. What do you think?
